title: Ford CEO: Self-driving cars coming within four years | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Ford
logo](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Ford could have fully autonomous cars on the market within four years.**

Earlier in the year Google predicted that its self-driving cars would be in
use on public roads [within five
years](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/google-sees-its-self-driving-cars-
on-the-road-within-five-years). It was widely believed that the internet giant
was leading the autonomous car race.

It turns out, however, that Ford thinks it can go one better. Speaking to
reporters recently, Ford CEO Mark Fields said (via
[Recode](http://recode.net/2015/11/18/ford-ceo-mark-fields-is-trying-to-keep-
one-foot-in-today-one-in-tomorrow/)) that his company’s fully autonomous car
project could be on the road in four years’ time.

The potential obstacles, according to Fields, are legislative in nature rather
than technological. Having said that, Fields is confident that “Technology
tends to lead all that.”

**Related:[Driverless Cars: Everything you need to
know](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinions/driverless-cars-what-you-need-
to-know)**

Ford recently announced that it had begin testing its autonomous car project
at a 32-acre test layout called Mcity. It provides a full-scale urban
environment in which to try out its self-driving technology.

Fields claimed that Ford was shifting its focus to becoming “a mobility
company and an auto company,” with part of the company focused on selling
traditional cars and the other part looking to where transportation will be in
20 years.
